abstract: Rusal, the world’s biggest aluminum maker, may not be able to sell shares to retail investors even if it wins approval for its increasingly troubled $2 billion Hong Kong initial public offering.
snippet: Rusal, the world’s biggest aluminum maker, may not be able to sell shares to retail investors even if it wins approval for its increasingly troubled $2 billion Hong Kong initial public offering.
lead_paragraph: Rusal, the world’s biggest aluminum maker, may not be able to sell shares to retail investors even if it wins approval for its increasingly troubled $2 billion Hong Kong initial public offering.

headline.main: Rusal Faces Potential Retail Investor Ban For I.P.O.
